== Main Inclusion Report for f-spot ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/f/f-spot, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Photo management application for desktop
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=f-spot|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=f-spot|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:f-spot|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/f/f-spot.html|maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://www.f-spot.org|upstream]]</nowiki>.
** No critical bugs in http://cve.mitre.org/cve/ , http://secunia.com/products , http://people.ubuntu.com/~pitti/ubuntu-cve/unfixed.html , http://people.ubuntu.com/~pitti/ubuntu-cve/unchecked.html
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Standard cdbs packaging, standard patch system (dpatch).
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in Main
 0. ''Recommends:''
** dcraw, currently in universe
